answers.answer: A vascular specialist can help with circulation diagnoses, but pain and numbness could be from diabetes or maybe nerve compression.  Does the pain/numbness occur all the time, or at certain times-like when you walk?  If it is caused by walking it could be nerve compression.  What kind of abscess did you have?  Maybe you have another abscess one pressing on the nerves to your legs?  Stomach pain could be many things...ulcer?  Not sure of medications...I get worse when I take medications.  How do you know the Prednisone helps your circulation?  Did the doctor check this?  Prednisone made my stomach hurt and caused me to vomit.  Does your stomach hurt when you take it?  (They gave it to me when trying to see if it would help, my muscle pain, and it did not.)  PAD can be diagnosed with an ultrasound test of the bood vessels in your legs, or by taking the blood pressure in your legs, and comparing it to the blood presure in your arms.  To see if your leg blood pressure is weak.  Hope this helps.

question: Dear Sir/Madame,I was in the ER with an abscess on my upper back.  I've had circulation problems for a few years and pain/numbness in my feet, legs/arms, maybe PAD.  Recently I had some pain in my left stomach and right groin area.  when I take prednisone my circulation improves and I feel warmth in my feet.what kind of doctor should I see for the circulation?  would I be helped by any medications?thanks so much
title: Pain/numbness in feet/arms
